a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Total population living in extreme poverty by world region
Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of $2.15 per day. This data is adjusted
for inflation and for differences in living costs between countries.
Data source: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)

Note: This data is expressed in
international-$
at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes

and benefits, or to consumption,
per capita
.
